title: Provides that a person may not be compensated based upon the number of signed voter registration cards he or she collects
summary: Provides that a person may not be compensated based upon the number of signed voter registration cards he or she collects.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1125

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  PARKER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Elections

       AN ACT to amend the election law,  in  relation  to  voter  registration
         cards

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The election law is amended by adding a new  section  5-229
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S  5-229.  PAYMENT  FOR  VOTER  REGISTRATION  CARDS.  A PERSON MAY NOT
    4  RECEIVE MONEY OR ANY OTHER THING OF VALUE BASED ON THE NUMBER OF  SIGNED
    5  VOTER REGISTRATION CARDS SUCH PERSON COLLECTS.
    6    S  2.  This act shall take effect immediately and shall apply to voter
    7  registration cards collected on or after such effective date.







        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01753-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to voter registration cards
